name: fluidly
content:
fluidly adverb
(SMOOTHLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a smooth and continuous way: She moves fluidly around the room, like a dancer. These exercises will allow you to breathe more easily and pedal the bike more fluidly. Related word
fluid
More examplesFewer examplesWith modern rock, you play a lot faster, a lot more fluidly.He slid fluidly into the driver's seat and reversed out of the driveway.

fluidly adverb
(WITHOUT INTERRUPTION)
in a way that does not involve any sudden changes, interruption, or difficulty: She tells her stories fluidly, never losing the reader's interest. The play moves fluidly between scenes.
More examplesFewer examplesFluidly mixing humour with inspiration, he urged the audience to teach morality to their students.He moves fluidly from discussing religion to politics, and from ideology to spirituality.In her role, she moves fluidly between states of quiet emotional loneliness and manic hysteria.
